data.title: Ouch
data.text:
I assume every diner at least has a good burger and good fries but this restaurant has very mediocre burgers and h WORST FRIES I have ever had and the onion rings were also pretty darn gross as well.

You should only eat heee if you have no other options EVER and even then it's a truly bad idea :(

data.title: Good 50's Food
data.text: Good old fashioned American food with a burger, fries, and a malt/shake. There are always a lot of families in here. Pretty good food but can't eat there every night.

data.title: Stopped here for dessert!
data.text: My friends and I just wanted dessert.  Yelp led us here.  We ordered peach and blueberry cobblers ala mode and one brownie sundae.  So delicious!  The coffee was very good, too.  Our waitress was friendly.  Would come back and try a regular meal sometime.

data.title: Casual diner with good food.
data.text: Local place, good food at a reasonable price. Breakfast is served all day, with weekday specials before 11 AM. Full dinners, burgers, snacks, shakes, malts and old fashioned sodas.

data.title: California Diner Food - Excellent Breakfast with Wonderful Service
data.text:
While looking around for a decent breakfast place on Balboa Island,we asked a local for a recommendation.  After she jumped, she asked me if the Van I was standing in front of was mine.  The van was for a mobile doggie wash.  I was taken aback by the comment by the entitled lady that I almost did not hear her tell us of Woody's Diner at the Lido. 

Thankfully, I did hear her though and walked away to my car before I was stuck washing her dog.  We proceeded down the street to the Lido and parked.  Woody's is set deep in the back of the building in front nearest the street.   As you approach, the cooking odors makes you hungrier.  We were seated right away by a lovely hostess and within minutes, our waitress appeared to get our drinks.  Her name was Shawny, an alluring Polynesian Hawaiian woman, that was refreshingly honest and sincere. She offered the specials which had funny names but ended up as delicious breakfast. My wife ordered a special skillet platter with scrambled eggs, potatoes, cheese and Kielbasa sausage (three large pieces).  She enjoyed every bite but brought half back to the hotel.  A coworker ordered the fruit covered, cinnamon infused French Toast that he declared the best he's ever had.  My omelet was cooked to perfection with lots of ham bits and diced peppers.  I had a side of fruit that was ripe and mouthwatering.  The fruit was so ripe it melted in your mouth.  The omelet was cooked light and tasty and as good as anyone else's choice.  Shawny came back to us many times to see that we were pleased, many times without saying a word.  When we stopped her to ask us about the her wonderful story, she was very talkative and humorous.  We were normal people talking with a normal person and enjoying her company.  The food was great, the service wonderful and the place had the charm of an oceanside restaurant.  We'd all come back here over and over again.

data.title: Delicious
data.text: Milk shakes and Black Cow the way it should be.  Oh, yumm.  Nice classic gem in the heart of old Newport Beach.

data.title: Great breakfast spot
data.text: Excellent breakfast. Very friendly service. Good value. Go early on the weekends - it is a popular spot.

data.title: Decent Diner Fare
data.text: Had a decent breakfast here. My cinnamon bread French toast was ok but not exceptional. My companion's skillet breakfast was also decent.  Service was adequate but a bit slow and inattentive.

data.title: Small town cafe in Newport Beach
data.text: Woody's is your basic small town café. Breakfast, lunch or dinner. Breakfast served open to close. Salads, burgers, meat loaf, turkey dinners and a lot more. Big menu with lots of choices. Located next tot he Lido theater a very popular local hangout.

data.title: Disappointing
data.text: Cute place in an excellent location. Ate there twice and both times the food was disappointing. Portions are small-ish and the food is blah. In this upscale, beach town location the food should be higher quality. Note to restaurant owners: instruct your kitchen staff to stir the cranberry sauce a little so it wont be served in the exact shape of the tin can it came out of.

data.title: Always a good choice
data.text:
I go here about 1-2 times a week. Its always a great experience. The staff is always on point and attentive but not pushy. I can't remember ever waiting for a glass to be filled or long time for a meal. Even the trainees are great. If they don't know they find out right away! Food has reasonable prices and you can count on delicious. Even when busy this place can whip out a seat for you and offer fast service.

Earned my business for life.

data.title: Great Breakfast
data.text: Woodys is a typical diner - breakfast, burgers and home cooking.  It is a great place for breakfast!  Lots of egg choices, including many omelettes, pancakes, and the Woody's special potatoes (which are awesome).  Service is generally pretty quick.  There's a wait on weekends but if you are willing to sit at the counter you can usually circumvent the line.

data.title: One of the great Diners
data.text: Can't go wrong at any meal - breakfast includes all the usual plus cinamon rolls. Corned beef has is especially good.  For lunch, the soups are the stars.  Tomato artichoke is a real treat but so is vegetable or noodle.  Meatloaf was a hit with one of our group.  You can get comfort food or eat healthy - your choice here.

data.title: Basic, but good diner fare.
data.text: Basic diner food, served in ample portions. Large selection of malts and shakes.  Consistently solid food.

data.title: An Old Fave
data.text: Love Woody's! Great menu. Fun ambience. Can't go wrong here on food, I don't think. Try the patty melt, the burgers and the omelets.

data.title: Convenient, Comforable Atmosphere
data.text: Good place for breakfast with the locals from Lido Isle. All the food is good. Your expectations will be adequately met (but probably not exceeded).

data.title: NO BIG DEAL!
data.text:
Stopped in to this restaurant on Lido Walk for breakfast.  Ordered French Toast and Bacon medium cooked.  The atmosphere is pleasant and service was friendly and nice.

French a toast barely thicker than a regular piece of bread.  Flavor was just OK.

Bacon arrived cold and over cooked past well done.  Resembled a shoe sole.  Brought it to trend attention and they returned with another order hit and medium cooked.  Bottom line this is just terrible bacon.  Little taste overall.

Don't think it's worth another visit, for breakfast anyway.

data.title: Great Sunday Champagne Breakfast
data.text: Friends took us to Woody's and we truly enjoyed ourselves. The Champagne was never ending and served with a smile. We had Eggs Benny and they were good. A bite pricey but with all the champagne  well worth the price. It is a simple spot in the harbour but service was great,had great conversations with other patrons,truly enjoyed ourselves.

data.title: "A Great Place For A Texas-Sized Cheeseburger"
data.text:
For just a little more $$, than you would pay to eat at a fast food establishment,this place does a good job. And you don't have to pay for any parking,and their within easy access to where ever your traveling,up or down PCH/HWY 1, or North on The Costa Mesa Freeway HWY 55 or south down to Balboa Peninsula & Balboa Island. A family of 4 or less could feed everyone for under $50.00. 
Their Texas sized Cheeseburger is the best if you love Cheeseburgers.

data.title: Manager gives dirty work to busboy!!
data.text:
I have been going here for years until December 19th around 2:30 pm. As always I bring my dogs with me.  My snow white Bishon always sits on the chair next to me.  Well this time the busboy came out and said the my Bishon could not sit on their dirty, rusty wrought iron chair and had to sit on the dirty concrete.   You could tell that he was embarrassed and the chicken manager sent him out to do his dirty work.  So Sunday (not my choice) we went here again and I brought my own chair for my Bishon.   Well, I was so pissed off when I saw 2 dogs sitting on the chairs next to their owners and one person feeding his dog out of his plate.  Not one word was said to them.  So I will never go there again and the food is ok!!   
Thank you for reading my review.
